website_summaries.verdict: The large lenses of these binoculars make them a great choice for beginning stargazers.
pros: Large 50 millimeter lenses, perfect for stargazing
Can be attached on a tripod
Lightweight enough to carry with you on a hike
cons: These binoculars aren't powerful enough to please avid stargazers

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the $,  but far from great
customer_reviews.text: These feel good in the hands, and at 7x50 they have great brightness, and not so much power that you must lean them on something steady to avoid jitter. And with a 7mm exit pupil 7x50 is pretty much ideal for low light. However the glass/coatings are far from great... tons of spherical aberration on the outer 1/4 of the image (fuzziness around the edges of the image). Overall not bad for the price, but I only get a very clear image in the inner 1/2 of the total image.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ojeda

customer_reviews.title: A stellar choice!
customer_reviews.text: I think these binoculars are the best $35 I ever spent! Really light to hold and easy to focus. I can't believe the stars I'm able to see. I live in NYC where of course there is horrible light pollution. With these, I can see at least 10 stars for every one I can see unaided. They also work just fine in the daytime. I am going to buy some for gifts - they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Aquarian Here

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Love these binoculars. They are pretty impressive when I go looking at the stars at night. Very clear! Alil heavy for me to stay steady, but I figured they would be...for me anyways. Wish they didn't fog up sometimes, but that is normal. Have taught so many friends and family how to correctly focus and look thru binoculars with these things. Lots of good times out at camp, near dark, looking at wild game and the moon.
customer_reviews.author: Twin2

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PARTS
customer_reviews.text: These were a used item in very good condition. The binoculars are in great condition, BUT they did not come with all of the items included in the original packaging. The description of the product provided by Amazon did NOT specify anything was missing. I really needed the neck strap for the binoculars. Now I have to see if I can procure from the manufacturer. What a hassle! Amazon should have specified along with "comes in original packaging" that not all items were included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These binoculars are great! Been using them with my kids for a ...
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are great! Been using them with my kids for a long time now, and might buy a second pair, since the price is so great, so they stop fighting over who gets to use them next. We use them for night sky watching, but also for birds in the back yard, as well as airplanes flying overhead. I would buy these again, and I would recommend them to anyone looking for a good set of binoculars for a a new hobby.
customer_reviews.author: hakbox android

customer_reviews.title: Seeing Double
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on March 1 and they seemed to work pretty well. A couple of weeks ago, I started seeing double, but I thought it was just me, even though I have 20/20 vision. Read the manual to make sure it was adjuste correctly abs still seeing double. The return window closed on April 3. There is a two year warranty, but o have to pay to ship/insure. Not sure it’s even worth it. Spend more to get a better pair. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KLR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after purchasing the Celestron 15x70 skymaster. And as other reviews mentioned the cometron is better in many ways. Cometron is clearer and easier to handle due to the weight and size and the field is fantastic. And one you consider the price difference it's the cherry on top. For comparison the skymaster has a great deal of zoom but the collimation just took all the fun out. And it doesn't take in as much light so the image isn't crisp. The size makes it difficult to hold steady but then again I'm a shaker but even my partner has issues and he's as still as a rock.
customer_reviews.author: BGAETA

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Have been watching the night sky and enjoying the view, but also used them for watching the landscape from a mountain. I have some old Hialeah acromatic 7*50 binoculars and when comparing them, I think the result is a little obvious, during daylight the HIaleah's gave me better color the Celestion's were a little opaque, however at night the Celestion's capture much more light. In other words, these Celestions are great general purpose binoculars with an ace up their sleeves when it comes to using them for what they were designed for. Also, they are pretty darn comfy too ...
customer_reviews.author: EdelCorralLira

customer_reviews.title: Really fantastic quality for standard-sized 7X50 binoculars for this price
customer_reviews.text: Really fantastic quality for standard-sized 7X50 binoculars for this price. Not just for Astronomy. Great for daytime use, & birding too. Really helps brighten stuff up in the shadows or dim areas. Just the right magnification to be able to hold them steady without a tripod. Easily scan the stars like you're flying out there. Really brings out star colors well. Higher magnifications makes it difficult not to get a jittery image unless you have a tripod. This is the perfect size & magnification for normal hand-held use.
customer_reviews.author: VJJohn

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I love this cheaper binoculars over their telescope. I thought the travel telescope from the same brand would be perfect for backyard and camping but I couldn’t see well through it. These are a fraction of the price and so easy to operate, even for children. It’s way more portable. I totally love it!
customer_reviews.author: Minimodernmom

customer_reviews.text: Looking back, I really don't know why I purchased these. I read an article that stated these were good for beginning star gazers but they're not. They seem of very high quality and are quite strong but since I have no interesting neighbors to spy on and not many interesting local birds to watch, I just shake my head in puzzlement and look for a good place to store them away. IMPULSE SHOPPING: not good.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars!!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of binoculars. Grip is comfortable. Field of vision is great. I use these binoculars for celestial viewing as well as bird watching and the binoculars serve well for both. The views of the moon have been stellar and I have been able to get very good views of the Orion Nebula. These are a fantastic pair of binoculars for any beginner or novice star gazer or astronomer and the price simply can't be beat. A highly recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great first binocular - stargazing / birdwatching
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my girlfriend as an early holiday gift. We camp a lot and want to start stargazing more during our hikes and camp adventures. We used these on our balcony to check out some stars and the craters and surface of moon. Was great! Excellent first set of binoculars! We managed to be able to identify all seas, craters, and mountains on the moon pretty easily and constellations became more clear and defined. Also great for bird watching when we are on our hikes. Overall! Very happy with this gift. And my girlfriend absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Clau Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Severely out of collimation. Double vision on everything viewed. Would expect better from Celestron. I have a lot of astronomy equipment but this is my first experience with this company. I know they are cheap binoculars but they are made to view the night sky and fail miserably at it. Very disappointed. Would not reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better for day use
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted something decent for star gazing and looking up at the moon but wasn't expensive. I learned that objective lenses size mattered more than magnification to reduce the "shakiness" of what you viewed. Unfortunately, these are not great for star gazing but do a slightly better job while looking at the moon. These are GREAT for day light use though so I'll hang on to them.
customer_reviews.author: dany

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard stargazing
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a beginners telescope for Christmas and after reading a lot of advice on choosing one, opted for a pair of 7x50 binoculars to go along with it. Can’t take the scope for a test run before Santa comes, but we tried out the binoculars the other night. DH and I were pretty amazed at what we could see. We could easily make out M42 in the Orion Nebula, and the Pleiades, which I have always loved but never seen so closely! We have 2 kids that are very interested in space and plan to order another pair so everybody can get a good look. And at this price, no need to wait!
customer_reviews.author: Alicat

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for eclipse
customer_reviews.text: Used them for the eclipse (taped eclipse glasses over them) and they worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Yang

customer_reviews.title: The way the small lenses are mounted, they tilt inward.
customer_reviews.text: After a few hours trying to calibrate it I discovered that the way the small lenses are mounted, they tilt inward. If I focus the center of the image, then I can use my thumbs to press the outside of the lenses and bring the whole picture into focus. The mounting system for the small lenses is very flexible. I'm returning these and trying the Nikon Action Extreme All Terrain 7x50 which cost $100 more than these do. Hope those work right.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro Polak

customer_reviews.title: Celestron 7 X 50 Binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are a little bulky and I found one disadvantage with the lens covers. I obtained other binoculars that had built in slots on the lens covers so that the covers were always available to place back over the eye or viewing lenses. These binoculars have no such slots so the covers are easily lost or misplaced. Aside from that, they had a good view with the 7 X 50 magnification.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lynskey

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate the durability of these binocs (haven't had them very long) but the optics exceeded my expectations. The sharpness, both center and edge-to-edge, is excellent and rival my Nikon 7x50 (at 5 times the cost). The Nikon has a bit more contrast and is a little brighter but side-by-side there's very little difference in non-critical use. These binocs also have the same (or similar) blue-green lens coating for improved performance. An amazing value at the price...very pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Purchased for stargazing, can see a nice lot even it polluted skies. The moon looks great and have also used it for wildlife and nature viewing, works fantastic for all. Bigger than you average outdoor binos but not at all for one that's meant for the sky. Sturdy and good quality, easy to focus and offers excellent magnification without the need for stabilization (tripod ect...). Far from the best, but for the price and if this is your budget, it's an automatic no-brainer
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dahan

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these units!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two pair, one for the boat and one for home. Both look and work wonderful. One has the ink on the lettering still wet so I did get a few white smudges on the units that I had to clean off. The lens quality though is great, as is the alignment and feel. Would I buy again? Heck yes! I may buy a few as christmas presents! This is one of the beat deals I have bought on amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Vertigo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use binoculars that come with a guide on how to adjust the focus just right. Great for viewing the Moon. I added solar filters, and had great views of the sun during the eclipse too! I would mount it on a tripod if you want to view planets since it's a little hard to hold smaller objects steadily in view.
customer_reviews.author: lightninglesley

customer_reviews.title: Bought to use with Pandia Press' Night Sky Journal
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality - kid was thrilled to be able to clearly see the craters on the moon. As we read in the SEA Homeschooler magazine, the stars are still fuzzy - and I will be buying another Celesteon binoc set for a clearer picture since kid is very interested, BUT these are excellent starter binocs for nightly use.
customer_reviews.author: BruiserMommy

customer_reviews.title: There’s nothing to think about. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! After reading everyone’s reviews I decided to take the risk and buy this product. Let me make this simple for you—> buy it! There’s nothing to think about because this item is a steal! If you just want to casually look up at the sky and get lost in the stars these binoculars are for you. It was worth taking the risk. Great product. Hope my review helped for those who were just like me at some point shopping around for a good pair of binoculars. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The pair I received had a "double image" problem that I could not get rid of with the provided adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: CJTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great to get you watching the night skies...and so light to hold!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the light weight feel of these binoculars and also the crisp images I can obtain...These are wonderful in daylight also...No problems at all with my eyeglasses...Great starting point in backyard astronomy...Just wish the case were a hard case the straps were nicer...They cut into your neck.
customer_reviews.author: BelleBelle

customer_reviews.title: Focus Issues and Can't Mount on Tripod
customer_reviews.text: This pair of binoculars can't be mounted on a tripod which is a non-starter for me, regardless of the price point. Also I had issues with focusing to a crisp point when viewing stars. You'd figure that a pair of binocs from Celestron would at least be able to do that. I gave it 3 stars because of the price point, but if you want to use these for viewing the sky I suggest you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: MidnightRider

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner stargazers!
customer_reviews.text: This binocular is superb for any beginner stargazer. I brought it to my recent trip to Acadia national park and I was able to see nearly 2x more stars than I could with my naked eye. You can also get up close and personal with constellations you recognize. It's great for anyone who loves stargazing and enjoy finding constellations.
customer_reviews.author: anhtran

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of binoculars. Well worth this price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of binoculars for the money. They are great for the night sky viewing I bought them for. I have a telescope for more close up views. They are light enough for hand held viewing. They feel well made/sturdy and should last a long time with proper care. Only thing I would change is that the lense covers are not attached and could get lost fairly easy. At this price point I don't think you will find better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thomas

customer_reviews.title: That's no moon...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try these out. And after a positive review from space.com, I purchased these to start with. Looking at stars seemed fine, but when I went to go look at the moon, I'd see a 2nd moon to the left of it. I called amazon to get them returned, and got a 2nd pair sent to me as a replacement. Same issue, but the 2nd image was in a different location in the binoculars. Two for two on the poor quality side.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fluhmann

customer_reviews.title: Clear sight
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as an alternative to dragging my telescope around for good look at the comet. We saw it! WOW. Sharp sight and light, easy carry to get far enough away from the city lights. I used them more for night use, results are the same for day watching. Good for camping.
customer_reviews.author: M james

customer_reviews.title: You can see fine, but watch where you put your hands!
customer_reviews.text: The viewing part works fine, as stated. HOWEVER, the words you can see in white on the sides--the paint came off on my hands the first time I picked the binoculars up to use them. The whole thing ended up feeling sticky under my fingers, and it took several scrubbings with a semi abrasive soap to get the paint off my hands. I patted the sides down with a paper towel, which helped to alleviate the mess, but a little still comes off even now. Overall, they are serviceable, but I expected the craftsmanship to be a bit better, so I am tempered by disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Lokisdotter

customer_reviews.title: Work great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used these in Yellowstone and several wildlife watcher were impressed with them. They aren't going to give you drop dead views of animals a half mile away but you can see incredibly far with them. I was able to see a gray wold and a black bear at least almost a mile away.
customer_reviews.author: Feather Chucker

customer_reviews.title: 7×10 binocs.
customer_reviews.text: I always take of what I buy. But I picked these up for easy use and kind of knock around binocs. My others are somewhat more expensive so treat them more gently. These had good reviews, unlike other name brand ones. A nice clear view right to the edges of the lens. They feel a little sloppy on the fit but focus well and hold it. Got the 7×10 so less jitter while I hold them,much more and you're starting to look for a place to brace them. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jasom K.

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful with the Eyepiece Lens Cap
customer_reviews.text: These do the trick as I use them to gaze at the moon with my grandchildren. You can't really see anything too specific but it is a nice magnification for some detail. Be careful putting the lens cap back on the eyepiece. If they are extended and you press down too hard, the cross piece will easily break. I found out the hard way as this is my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They both love it. Pulls in enough light to see stars ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two - one for my dad and one for my son. They both love it. Pulls in enough light to see stars in town that you can't see with the naked eye. Magnification is just right - any more and you'd be looking at shakes and streaks the entire time. Now we keep it by the back door so I we can use them whenever we step into the back yard. Not a replacement for a telescope, but its a good starting device and really convenient (taking out one of my scopes, setting, up etc. takes time).
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely bang for your buck. It's very well made with solid quality. And the image is very clear comparing to another higher power binoculars I have used. It's powerful enough for one to see many stars not obviously for naked eyes. It's also good for general purpose observation such as sight seeing, bird watching, whale watching and sport events. I like it's medium size build, not too bulky or heavy to carry along.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Great Binos for Looking at Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I am love with these Binos! These got my wife into astronomy and now she comes with when I look at/image the sky. These binoculars are exceptional in that you DO NOT need a tripod to use the smaller ones (7x50).
customer_reviews.author: TB1990

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The apparent field of view is fairly narrow -- I'd estimate around 40 degrees. So these don't actually have a wider true field of view than my cheap 10x50 binoculars (around 6 degrees). And a lot of things about them are pretty cheap, like the rigid plastic eye cups and so on. But those are my only complaints -- they provide a fine image, and the 7x magnification is just right for hand-holding. My hands shake a little, but at 7x the view still looks good. I'd be disappointed if I had paid a premium price, but I didn't!
customer_reviews.author: greg alexander

customer_reviews.title: You’ll enjoy these
customer_reviews.text: Good field of view, a little tiring to hold but still a good companion to a telescope or just a plain old good thing to have for quick back yard astronomy. I know my ranking wasn’t five stars but I would buy another pair if I needed another. I would recommend these for someone who wants to dabble in amateur astronomy for the first time or someone, like me, who wanted an affordable pair to compliment a more expensive telescope set up.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: These are great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are great and easy to use. My first pair for stargazing and they really are nice and easy to use. The case is durable and they fit in easy. Really love these! We've all seen pictures of the Moon, but it's just so cool to see it close up with your own binoculars. Very nice for beginner star gazing.
customer_reviews.author: Bella B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for star gazing!
customer_reviews.text: We got this on time for the blood moon lunar eclipse and it was fantastic. We are able to see the craters of the moon with this and we watched the phases of the eclipse easily. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Salgado

customer_reviews.title: ... them as part of the planet which will look like the aides are bulging If you see dancing lines ...
customer_reviews.text: You will not see Saturns rings with these but you will see them as part of the planet which will look like the sides are bulging Remember that stats twinkle but planets don't. I was looking at what I though was Saturn for three nights until I realized with the help of the SkyView app that it was a star. Once I found a planet I saw the difference. If you see dancing squiggly lines then you do not have a steady enough hand and need to get a tripod. Makes the biggest difference in focusing Someone said the quality of these binoculars was cheap but I disagree. Sturdy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent set. You're able to see the moon pretty good but that's it as far as stargazing goes. So I would say this is good for someone who wants a taste of what you could see in the sky but this is definitely no substitute for a telescope. After maybe 4 uses I realize that I need a telescope now. So if you are wanting to see planets or the moon in great detail, skip on this and wait to get a telescope
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Don't be nervous by the price...these are great!
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me! For under 25 bucks, these binoculars are amazing! We spent $10 for some cheap kid's toy binoculars at Yellowstone National Park, and when I found these for just over double the price, I couldn't believe the quality! Great for day or night, they have made our travels through national parks much more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Haralambobby

customer_reviews.title: nice binoculars
customer_reviews.text: got these for my 13 year old. Pretty light. He uses them quite a bit. Bird watching, and looking at stars or even wild life at night. Gets up close and you can see detail even in pretty dark situations. Seem sturdy. Adjustable. can be attached to tripod with adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: Mamamia

customer_reviews.title: Solid beginner binoculars for astronomy
customer_reviews.text: I took these on my trip to a few areas that had better views of the night sky. These binoculars worked great to help identify different star constellations and allowed amazing sights of the moon. They also work great during the day for any landscape or animal viewing. Perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: CELESTRON Delivers Quality
customer_reviews.text: Celestron - Cometron 7x50 Binoculars deliver. These binoculars are " AWESOM " the clarity of the " LENS " are super good. Thank you Celestron. Two thumbs-up.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Celestron 71198 Cometron 7x50 Binoculars (Black)
customer_reviews.text: A very clear picture at a night time. Large exit pupil provides high resolution of observing object(weather condition should be taken into consideration). Especially was surprised when located the moon. Craters were clearly seen. But do not be confused. You will not be able to see craters in details. In addition some pics that will provide additional understanding of the product. The binocular adapter for a tripod that is on a pic was bought separately.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: they provide a wonderful boost! The double-double looks beautiful and I can ...
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing these as my gateway into stargazing, I've taken them to several dark sites and tried them out. I have no complaints, they provide a wonderful boost! The double-double looks beautiful and I can even make out hazy globular clusters. The design is sleek and they're easy to focus, even to account for my asymmetrical eyesight.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Boll

customer_reviews.title: Alignment is off
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and it didn't work out. Alignment is off so you get a headache after looking through these for more than a minute. The image is clear and everything else about them is nice, but if you can't use them for extended periods of time, what's the point? And I'm not going to try to collimate them myself. They should work out of the box. Rather disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dave L.

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for an astronomy class
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are great. I never knew binoculars would work for stargazing, but they do. I can even see the texture of the moon. I love these things, I would highly recommend them. If you are getting these for astronomy, definitely get the tripod (I did not, but am searching one out now), stars tend bounce because they are so tiny. No matter how steady your hand is, there shaking from your breath and heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: METAL-MARSALA

customer_reviews.title: Meets all the specs, for a fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: Magnification: 7 (greater than ~10 will have difficulty keeping steady) Exit pupil: 50/7 ~7 (for low light the dilated pupil needs ~7) Eye Relief: 13 (>11 for prescription 👓) Foldable eye guard (again for prescription 👓)
customer_reviews.author: JesSam

customer_reviews.title: These Are dope esp if you like the herb & love the stars oh yea
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome only problem is you really notice your nerves shake in your hands when hold this up at the night sky I let my friend borrow em and she agreed I recommend them but to probably get the full potential out of em I suggest purchasing a tripod stand for it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s amazing what the human eye can see out there with these binoculars! It truly was astonishing and unbelievable. I was able to see some of Jupiter’s moons, star clusters that I couldn’t see with the naked eye, and I much more! You definitely gotta purchase these to know what I am talking about. It is amazing what is out there.
customer_reviews.author: Viviana Lara

customer_reviews.title: New Stargazer here!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice binoculars. For star gazing, remember you are just looking a little closer to the sky with them. Its not like you can see any great detail or anything like that (at least I couldn't). But, its still amazing to see the moon close up when it is full. These are great to start off with if you are new to astronomy. They are a great quality, strong binocular. Slightly heavy, so you might want to buy a stand. Overall, am happy with my purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: lisamc13

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, my images will not line up. I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my images will not line up. I've done everything I can, but, I still have double vision through these binoculars. I bought them and received them the day before I was catching a flight to the Bahamas for work as I'd be there 6 weeks and figured I'd see some clear night skies. I am only able to look through one side however, and the full moon looked incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After she received it she texted me that she loved her binoculars so out of curiosity I purchased another ...
customer_reviews.text: I had initially purchase one for my daughter who loves astrology. After she received it she texted me that she loved her binoculars so out of curiosity I purchased another one for my wife and I and all I can say is that my wife really enjoys it, but as for me well it's just ok.
customer_reviews.author: george paul sahagun

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars were bought as a gift, and the recipient uses them frequently. They are being used for star gazing, as well as being taken on walks for bird watching. Great value for these versatile binoculars!
customer_reviews.author: Jessabelluh

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: I love these binoculars. I use them in conjunction with my telescope or just by there self. You can see the Andromeda galaxy with these!!! It is somewhat of a blur, but looks the exact same as it does from a $500 telescope!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be as advertised. works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: bright clear sharp image. seems to work great. very sharp detailed image. high contrast. no light loss from elements inside.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Newman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A great pair of binoculars for amature astronomy and terrestrial viewing. The total package for an introductory into binocular viewing, the 7x power is just enough to see fine details without having to use a mount or tripod. The 50mm pulls in enough light to see the Andromeda galaxy even in city light pollution. At this price point, 38 dollars one can feel confident dragging them along on the most unforgiving of trips and they will still perform well. Also, celestron is known for good customer service if one was to recieve a pair with a defect. All in all, the right product for the job at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Simms

customer_reviews.title: Love these...perfect for casual sky viewing.
customer_reviews.text: You're not going to find a better set of binoculars for this price. They are easy to dial in, light weight, and exceeded my expectations for viewing the night sky. You could use these on a tripod but not necessary. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: D. Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL OPTICS!
customer_reviews.text: BEAUTIFUL OPTICS!!! Bought this to supplement a 16X50 for star gazing. My ONLY complaint is the eye relief allows light to bleed in from the sides which can negatively effect the view through the binoculars under certain conditions.
customer_reviews.author: B. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated ordering these because of the price. Yet, I knew Celestron with decades of experience with their telescopes. I was not disappointed. These binoculars are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Nojokes

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for us!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our boat to help spot landing beaches and obstacles in the water, so we didn't want to spend a lot of money on fine optics. These worked out perfectly... they're not top of the line, but they're absolutely good enough for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Rotten Racklefrack

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got these for visitors to the nature center to borrow. Obviously, I didn't want $300 binocs for that purpose. These function exactly as I hoped. The optics are good enough that someone can actually use them to ID birds. Will they last forever? Prob not. Will you be able to clinch that fall warbler ID at the top of a tall tree in bad light? Nope. But for people to take to the lake and observe ducks, use at the feeders to tell the difference between red bellied and downy woodpeckers, observe the wild turkeys, etc, they are perfect, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie West

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginning stargazers!
customer_reviews.text: After watching some videos on YouTube, we decided to try these binoculars and have not been disappointed. They are easy to use, we did buy the adapter and already had a tripod. We also recently purchased a laser pointer to make it easier for one of us to show the other exactly where we are looking. All in all we have learned a lot and have found an interest in common to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Boardwine

customer_reviews.title: good set of Binoculars at a great price
customer_reviews.text: good set of Binoculars at a great price. found this set references on a stargazer site and gave them a shot, NOT DISAPPOINTED! the quality at the price is surprising! very smooth focus.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: 6 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 6 year old as her Kindergarten graduation present. We use it for bird/animal watching on the trail & star gazing. She loves it. Spotting an airplane or a bird in the sky is easy and fun. Great product, well designed, easy to use and setup. Takes a bit to get adjusted to the sight, once you figure it out it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Suresh

customer_reviews.title: Value for price!
customer_reviews.text: These are only good for stars if the night is very clear and light pollution is very low. They were a lot of fun to take to the beach though. I was pretty rough on them. One of the eye pieces came off, but I was able to screw it back on. Focusing is fairly easy. I left my 2 pair at the coast with my friends. They'll get more use. I think I'm going to switch to a monocular for easy of travel.
customer_reviews.author: Audzilla

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed that a pair of binocs this inexpensive worked so well. I am used to a $400 pair & bought these for kids to use for under $30. They are clear sighted & are perfect for looking at the birds in our woods.
customer_reviews.author: s.a.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of binoculars, you get a pretty clear view on objects, but you should be aware that holding them for a while can be hard since they get a little heavy. It might be a great idea use them with a tripod if your hands shake a little, that some times make it hard to observe star clusters and constellations. But in general you get pretty decent and clear views for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Great For Daytime Bird Watching
customer_reviews.text: These are really great quality for bird watching. I have not used them for astro viewing yet so I cannot attest to their night time function but these are very crisp for daytime use.
customer_reviews.author: karmanleigh

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these binoculars, especially for the price. Image is crisp and adjustable. Compared to our old binoculars these things are amazing. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Miller

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't go wrong. They are easy to adjust and fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Do not hesitate to try these!
customer_reviews.text: I was a beginning star gazer, and wanted to take a Next Step towards viewing the night sky. These exceeded my expectations and although I've moved on to bigger and better equipment I still don't leave the house without these
customer_reviews.author: Fez Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Clear, good distance
customer_reviews.text: Working great for wildlife watching over the meadow and pond on the ajoining property
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Double image.
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are horrible. Everyone that has tried them sees a double image, one on top of another. Really bad for star gazing.
customer_reviews.author: Merchon Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Best binos
customer_reviews.text: These binos are the best quality, made of metal and plastic, and give a crisp clear image. I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: l&l

customer_reviews.title: Nice binoculars, and good price
customer_reviews.text: Nice binoculars, and good price. I bought these for stargazing, though i realize the aren’t as strong as the bigger, more expensive models. The bigger ones really need a tripod, since they’re so heavy. These will also be nice for birdwatching.
customer_reviews.author: Pattywolford

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are not expensive binoculars, but they work well for what they are.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: For sky watching this was a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to hold steady. star gazing magnification is not real good. Great for things on the planet that are lose....house across the street etc... absolutely need a tripod for extended watch sessions this was a gift and recipient rarely if ever uses it. It was a waste of my money for sky watching
customer_reviews.author: suzanne m.

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very good buy for the price. Quality company and well made for the price. 7 power is all you need for handheld.
customer_reviews.author: timmy

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: good vision thru it but quite bulky for kids to hold. good for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Rajat

customer_reviews.title: Great Bincoulars
customer_reviews.text: Great Bincoulars! Very good quality and easy to use. My family loves.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: my son loves these
customer_reviews.text: Awsome birthday present for my 10 year old son who enjoys stargazing and is enthralled by the supermoons . Makes me so happy to see him enjoy something other than eletronics 😊
customer_reviews.author: sweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Great for price, can not see lots of details
customer_reviews.text: I use these to look at the city sky where the stars are limited and the planets are the brightest. I was hoping to see Saturn's rings, but could not see them. I have found Jupiter's moons however faint. Great for the price, multiple uses. Easily spots faint stars in the sky that are not visible to naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: Aliza Brown

customer_reviews.title: This set of binoculars were recommended to me for star-gazing
customer_reviews.text: This set of binoculars were recommended to me for star-gazing, and I was not mis-guided! The build is solid, but not heavy. The finger grips are comfortably placed, thus easy to hold for extended viewing. Clean, crisp optics provide wonderful bird-watching as well. Would definitely recommend, high quality at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: nyc2gf

customer_reviews.title: Clarity on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Have only had them for several days but am impressed. Very crisp and clear--not cloudy. We'll see how they hold up, but for budget binocs they are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and can see the moon in great detail and many more stars. Best when laying down or your arms shake and get tired. Can also look at birds.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Collura

customer_reviews.title: Don't think twice!
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are absolutely amazing! They're a little shaky but it's to be expected when looking through any sort of binoculars or telescopes. The moon looks amazing and you can even see a few stars (despite of the dense fog in the LA area). Great binoculars and great price, I really recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Pawi

customer_reviews.title: No astronomical coatings?
customer_reviews.text: I don't think these binoculars are not as advertised. I don't see astronomical coatings. That makes them so so for daytime observing but not so good for nighttime observing. I have an older pair and the coatings are obvious.
customer_reviews.author: Michael js Thwaites

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not the best binoculars you can buy but for the price they are excellent. Good for a beginner, young child, or second pair. Found many sky sights and works great for bird watching. Overall a good basic pair of binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars for terrestrial and astronomy uses
customer_reviews.text: Great binoculars for terrestrial and astronomy uses. I also bought a tripod adapter and a phone bracket. Best $$ spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I would recommend buying a tripod mount to hold boniculars up. After a short while, my arms got tired of holding binoculars. I'm a beginner. Great, sturdy and quality product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Misses

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. You might not be able to see a planet close up but you can see more stars in the sky than with the unaided eye alone inside a city. A tripod is recommend to help reduce shaking.
customer_reviews.author: SAlovers

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. I got these for my daughter bday. I states that the are really good at night looking in the sky but my daughter really loves them on hikes and looking at nature
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Clarity
customer_reviews.text: I love the clarity, adjustability and light weight of binoculars
customer_reviews.author: Connie Adams

product_meta.title: Celestron - Cometron 7x50 Bincoulars - Beginner Astronomy Binoculars - Large 50mm Objective Lenses - Wide Field of View 7x Magnification
product_meta.description: Style:Cometron| Configuration:BinocularsGet ready for the next awe-inspiring comet with a pair of sleek, portable Celestron Cometron 7x50 binoculars. The large 50 mm objective lenses and multi-coated optics offer amazing light-gathering capabilities that bring celestial objects into bright, sharp focus, making them ideal for comet watching, stargazing, and viewing craters on the Moon. Cometron 7x50’s wide field of view lets you explore expansive swaths of the sky to quickly pinpoint exactly the object you want to see, then keeps it in your sights without constant movement. Cometron 7x50’s rubberized aluminum housing is durable, lightweight, and tripod adaptable for extended comfort during long stargazing sessions. The binoculars come with a wide neck strap and a carrying case for security, portability, and grab-and-go convenience. Nitrogen Filled: No. Carrying Case: Woven Nylon
feature_bullets: Wide field of view reveals a larger portion of the night sky, allowing you to view more of the comet's impressive tail
Large 50 mm objective lenses have tremendous light gathering ability, ideal for astronomical use
Multi coated optics dramatically increase light transmission for brighter images with increased contrast and resolution
Large exit pupil provides maximum light during nighttime and low light viewing sessions

Wide field of view reveals a larger portion of the night sky, allowing you to view more of the comet's impressive tail ^Large 50mm objective lenses have tremendous light-gathering ability, ideal for astronomical use ^Multi-coated optics dramatically increase light transmission for brighter images with increased contrast and resolution ^Large exit pupil provides maximum light during nighttime and low-light viewing sessions ^Strong and durable alumnium housing

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars847 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
